subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: New files in my Radio Shack Box Folder
author: ej schott
full_text:
--0-222043930-1199294959=:53869
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hey Debbie, 
  You only want to pick up the older Gray/white version and they don't have those at the RS in your area.  They are different and it is the gray 470 that can be modified so far...unless someone has figured that out yet?  I will keep an eye out for you on those, as I have been looking for one also.
  E

Debbie Tejada <debbie@...> wrote:
          Steve (or anyone else who knows about this),  

    The 
new 470 is all black and can't be modified as of yet   

  Based on your comments about the 12-469, I'm going to pick up a 12-470 later today. I called our local Radio Shack and the guy insisted that the new 12-470 is exactly the same as the old one, just the case is a different color (grey & black). I specifically asked if the electronics were set up the same way and he said yes, they're exactly the same. Do you suppose he's right about that? Or just doesn't know the product that well?
                    _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
  

  Debbie Tejada
  

  

  "Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy. "  ~Albert Einstein










    On Jan 1, 2008, at 8:44 PM, Steve Hultay wrote:

            There is no pulsing on the older style 12-470, just clear 
communication. My 12-469 is sitting in the corner and i'll probably 
never touch it again because that constant pulse noise is very 
distracting to get past to hear any audible messages. That's just my 
personal opinion anyway for what it's worth. If you listen to my 
radio shack files from today you will hear the difference between the 
two boxes. The sweep between the two are both linear, but one has 
the pulse sound and one is just a clean sweep without the pulse. Ask 
your local radio shack if they have any 12-470 older style models, 
they are gray with a white top and also has a built in speaker. The 
new 470 is all black and can't be modified as of yet but i think Mike 
C. could figure it out if he didn't have 500 other projects going at 
the same time....lol Any questions just shoot me an e-mail and i 
will help the best i can.

-Steve H.

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "babiarz3" <babiarz3@...> wrote:
>
> 
> Steve, hope your holidays were wonderful. We haven't had the chance 
to
> speak in a few weeks.
> What are the difference in the 469 and the 470 besides 2 channel vs.
> 4? You are still choosing one channel and it is still a linear sweep
> right? Technically, what would be the difference in choosing AM on 
the
> 469 and AM on the 470? The pulsing sound is absolutely annoying. 
> 
> Babs 
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@> wrote:
> >
> > 
> > Had a pretty good session today, i've been pretty blocked with 
other 
> > boxes yet i seem to always get great results with the RS 12-470. 
Some 
> > really good responses to my questions. Hey babs, i think you 
should 
> > give the RS box a little time and maybe you will start to get 
stuff. 
> > Although i have a 12-469 also and it really sux compared to the 
12-
> > 470. The constant pulsing noise in the 469 model just drives me 
crazy 
> > enough to not concentrate. Try looking for an older style model 
of the 
> > 12-470, that's probably the best radio i own hands down. Instant 
> > results always and consistently. All my boxes work, but they are 
> > finicky sometimes. No need to comment to my posted files guys, 
just 
> > listen and see if i'm on some sort of a right track with the 
> > communication.
> > 
> > -Steve H.
> >
>










  

                         


~It may be that your sole purpose in life is simply to serve as a warning to others~
